story.text: (adds details)AMSTERDAM Jan 2 (Reuters) - Dutch telecoms group KPN (KPN.AS) said on Tuesday it will reorganise in an attempt to improve its market share, turnover and profitability by serving clients based on a business and consumer approach. KPN's KPN.N fixed line and mobile divisions will merge in new groups called business market and consumers market to focus on clients instead of technology and products, KPN said in a statement. "We expect that this could fundamentally contribute to realise the growth of market share and turnover and profitability," KPN's Chief Executive Ad Scheepbouwer said. The restructuring will take effect from Jan. 1 and was announced last year. KPN's organisation in the Netherlands will consist of the groups called Wholesale & Operations, IT Netherlands and Corporate Center, in addition to business market and consumers market, KPN said.
story.title: update 1 - kpn reorganises divisions to focus on clients
